intro: Jucunda olfersiana, commonly known as the Olfers' joy, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
